meanings.definition: A cucumber preserved in vinegar or brine.
meanings.sent1: I love eating a crunchy pickle with my sandwich.
meanings.sent2: She added a pickle to her burger for extra flavor.
meanings.sent3: The pickle rolled off the plate and onto the floor, making everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: His decision to wear mismatched socks was a real pickle for his fashion reputation.
meanings.sent5: The pickle's tangy taste lingered on my taste buds long after I finished it.

meanings.sent1: Being lost in the maze was a real pickle for the kids.
meanings.sent2: She found herself in a pickle when her car broke down in the middle of nowhere.
meanings.sent3: Trying to juggle all her responsibilities was like being in a pickle jar.
meanings.sent4: The team faced a pickle when their star player got injured right before the championship game.
meanings.sent5: The unexpected rainstorm put us in a real pickle during our picnic.

meanings.definition: To preserve in a solution of vinegar or brine.
meanings.sent1: I like to pickle cucumbers from my garden to enjoy them all year round.
meanings.sent2: She learned how to pickle vegetables from her grandmother's old recipe.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to pickle the green tomatoes for a unique twist in the dish.
meanings.sent4: The tradition of pickling fruits has been passed down for generations in our family.
meanings.sent5: The pickled onions added a zesty kick to the salad.

meanings.definition: To put into a difficult situation.
meanings.sent1: He would often pickle his friends by giving them challenging riddles to solve.
meanings.sent2: She didn't mean to pickle her team by changing the project requirements last minute.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected test really pickled the students who hadn't studied.
meanings.sent4: The villain's plan was to pickle the hero by trapping him in a maze of mirrors.
meanings.sent5: The twist ending pickled the audience, leaving them in shock.
